title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one environmental impact on marine ecosystems associated with extraction or transportation of crude oil, such as any of the following:

  • Marine life is harmed/killed by being coated/suffocated by oil from spills

  • Animals are harmed/killed by ingesting spilled oil

  • Oil slicks from spills can block sunlight from entering water and inhibit photosynthesis

  • Oil that washes up on beaches/in marshes/in estuaries damages habitat

  • Noise pollution disrupts marine animals’ ability to communicate/mate/eat/evade prey

  • CO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHXgarmWu51MyVXgarqqtubsr4rNCHbcvPDwzYbGeaGqiFv0Je9sqqrpepiYdbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaaeaabaWaaaGcbaGaae4qaiaab+eadaWgaaWcbaGaaeOmaaqabaaaaa@3287@ from combustion of fuels in boats/equipment is absorbed by ocean and contributes to ocean acidification

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify an atmospheric pollutant released during the combustion of refined oil products, such as any of the following:

  • Carbon dioxide ( CO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHXgarmWu51MyVXgarqqtubsr4rNCHbcvPDwzYbGeaGqiFv0Je9sqqrpepiYdbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaaeaabaWaaaGcbaGaae4qaiaab+eadaWgaaWcbaGaaeOmaaqabaaaaa@3287@ )

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not propose a solution an individual can use to reduce their reliance on refined oil products for transportation, such as any of the following:

  • Ride a bike/scooter/skateboard or walk instead of driving

  • Replace a gasoline/diesel powered car with a hybrid or electric vehicle

  • Replace a gasoline/diesel powered car with one that utilizes alternative fuel (biodiesel, ethanol, hydrogen)

  • Buy/Drive a more fuel-efficient vehicle

  • Work from home/telecommute to reduce miles driven

  • Choose housing that is close to employment to reduce miles driven

  • Take public transportation instead of driving

  • Carpool instead of driving alone

  • Combine trips to reduce miles driven
